Well what I meant was that if we are k=
eeping sound separate from the=A0EM spectrum, then it is generated as a bi-=
product of some other thing's movements or vibrations. Such movements creat=
e waves in the environment that we hear as sound.
=A0

----- Original Messa=
ge ----- 
From: Frank Ratka 
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
Sent: Tuesday, J=
une 09, 2009 6:27 AM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas








No, that's no=
t what I mean. By nature EM waves don't normally make sound. The HAARP issu=
e in the NW is believe to be caused by some harmonic of the actual EM wave.=
 This is what I mean by secondary effect. EM waves can still effect the phy=
sical, which is the reason microwaves can cook you if the power is amped hi=
gh enough or causes a birds to twitch in its transmission beam. I have step=
ped into a microwave beam at moderate power in while in the military. It do=
esn't hurt (at least at the power it was at) but it sure made me feel very =
strange. Of course microwaves have very short wavelengths compared to VLF, =
ULF or SLF.
=A0
Frank R.

April, standard physics today defines four fundamental types of f=
orces: electromagnetism, gravity,=A0 and the strong and weak interaction of=
 elementary particles.=A0 So while EM is one type of energy (well, lets cal=
l it a force), there are a few others too.

From: Frank Ratk=
a

Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 2:05 PM
Subjec=
t: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas








Tell me where the seperation on the spec=
trum takes place between 300Hz and 300KHz. Yes, soundwaves cause pressure w=
aves that our ears read as vibration and our mind translates as sound. The =
waves are still on the electromagnetic spectrum. Even subsonic geomagnetic =
waves are present on the scale. What I mean by power can be directll transl=
ated to volume or amplitude. The only thing that distinguishes soundwaves f=
rom any other wave is the fact that we can hear them.
=A0
Frank R.

--- On =
Mon, 6/8/09, Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com> wrote:


From: Rj <rasterer@yahoo. co=
m>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Mond=
ay, June 8, 2009, 2:53 PM








No. Sounds waves are not on the electroma=
gnet spectrum nor are they a form of electromagnet energy. Sound waves are =
based on pressure waves in the air (or in other substances).=A0 Our ears de=
tect these pressure waves and translate them into sounds we here.=A0 Our ea=
r do NOT hear electromagnet energy.=A0 Our eyes do: that part which we call=
 visible light.



--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com=
> wrote:


From: Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-IT=
C] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 12:38=
 PM









It sounds like she's saying "one, two, ....."
=A0
A mistake th=
at a lot of people make is thinking that there are two different types of e=
nergy at work when it comes to sound waves and electromagnetic waves. The o=
nly thing that seperates them is frequency and power. Radio waves are radio=
 waves because they occupy a certain block of the electromagnietic spectrum=
. Sound waves exist on that same spectrum just farther down with much longe=
r waves. Soundwaves and subsonic waves can penetrate almost anything becaus=
e of their wavelengths. The shorter the wavelength the more ways we can shi=
eld against them.
=A0
Think of microwaves. These are also a type of radio a=
nd telemetry transmitting wave but the waves also have a physical effect on=
 our environment by causing molecules to speed up, which creates heat. A li=
ttle lower than this is IR or infrared it too can cause physical objects to=
 heat up but usually it just causes molecules to rotate in place. All physi=
cal things give off IR light. Its a way the total system conserves energy b=
y spontaneously emitting IR radiation.
=A0
Frank R.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Ap=
ril Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:


From: April=
 Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>

New ideas [3 Attachments]
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June 8=
, 2009, 2:27 PM





Here is some food for thought. I am currently reviewin=
g my audio from our May 30th investigation.
=A0
It was me and another girl =
teammate=A0present in the room. I picked up a 3rd female voice on my digita=
l voice recorder that I carry with me. We were standing right next to anoth=
er digital video recorder that I leave beside my night vision camera. That =
recorder did not pick up this 3rd voice. I have asked the girl that was wit=
h me to check her recording to see if she picked it up.
=A0
I have long fel=
t the true EVP does not come from sound waves in the environment, or then i=
t wouldn't be EVP, but a disembodied voice. Somehow EVP's are appearing dir=
ectly on the recordings.
=A0
This instance with the recorders may back that=
 theory up. That other recorder should have picked that voice up if it were=
 sound waves in the environment.
=A0
I am attaching the clip of this 3rd vo=
ice. The=A0file that is named=A0"01-02-17 Clip" is the full clip.=A0You wil=
l hear my voice as I say "Yeah", and then another comes in right after that=
. I think I know what it says.
=A0
Again, I was live monitoring my audio, b=
ut still did not hear this until playback. It isn't clear, so I am not as e=
xcited about it as my one's from the last investigation.
=A0
=A0

----- Ori=
ginal Message ----- 
From: Frank Ratka 
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
Sent:=
 Monday, June 08, 2009 1:09 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas








I h=
ave a running theory that EVP is carried on an untrasonic wave and demodula=
ted exactly where they want it to manifest. It works off the heterodyne pri=
nciple. If you mix two ultrasonic waves that differ one another in frequenc=
y then if you add or subtract them together you get a beat frequency or alt=
ernate frequency. For example, if a ghost is sending a signal at 54KHz and =
you have an electric fan in a room creating an untrasonic frequency at 45KH=
z then you will have a intermediate difference=A0frequency at 9KHz, well wi=
thin human hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz). This was just an example, but all=
 electronic equipment generates ultrasonic signals just by turning them on.=
 From this theory I always felt that EVP were generated within a few inches=
 of the recorder.
=A0
We are able to reproduce this affect in not only radi=
o with superheterodyne systems but also with acoustics and audio as in some=
 passive sonars and a commercial produce called the "audio spotlight" by Dr=
. Joseph Pompeii.
=A0
Frank R.

with a microphone wired to a remote site has ever gotten any EVP in real ti=
me.
=A0
I=A0took part in=A0an investigation of Ashmore Estates, near Ashmor=
e IL, on Saturday night. We had six video cameras set up in the three halls=
 of the building. The video for all=A0was being monitored and recorded=A0at=
 a central location. Alas, we did not have microphones at the camera sites =
conected to the central location. I wonder what we might have heard if we d=
id?

<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>A mistake that a lot of people make is t=
hinking that there are two different types of energy at work when it comes =
to sound waves and electromagnetic waves. The only thing that seperates the=
m is frequency and power. Radio waves are radio waves because they occupy a=
 certain block of the electromagnietic spectrum. Sound waves exist on that =
same spectrum just farther down with much longer waves. Soundwaves and subs=
onic waves can penetrate almost anything because of their wavelengths. The =
shorter the wavelength the more ways we can shield against them.</DIV>
<DIV=
> </DIV>
<DIV>Think of microwaves. These are also a type of radio and =
telemetry transmitting wave but the waves also have a physical effect on ou=
r environment by causing molecules to speed up, which creates heat. A littl=
e lower than this is IR or infrared it too can cause physical objects to he=
at up but usually it just causes molecules to rotate in place. All physical=
 things give off IR light. Its a way the total system conserves energy by s=
pontaneously emitting IR radiation.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>Frank R.<B=
R><BR>--- On <B>Mon, 6/8/09, April Abercrombie <I><april@abercrombiegh o=
stresearch. com></I></B> wrote:<BR></DIV>
<BLOCKQUOTE style=3D"BORDER-LE=

<BR><BR>
<DIV id=3Dyiv271114382>

picked up a 3rd female voice on my digital voice recorder that I carry with=

eave beside my night vision camera. That recorder did not pick up this 3rd =
voice. I have asked the girl that was with me to check her recording to see=
 if she picked it up.</FONT></DIV>
<DIV><FONT size=3D2 face=3D"Myriad Pro">=
</FONT> </DIV>
<DIV><FONT size=3D2 face=3D"Myriad Pro">I have long fel=
t the true EVP does not come from sound waves in the environment, or then i=
t wouldn't be EVP, but a disembodied voice. Somehow EVP's are appearing dir=
ectly on the recordings.</FONT></DIV>
<DIV><FONT size=3D2 face=3D"Myriad Pr=
o"></FONT> </DIV>

ve picked that voice up if it were sound waves in the environment.</FONT></=

<TD vAlign=3Dtop>
<DIV>I have a running theory that EV=
P is carried on an untrasonic wave and demodulated exactly where they want =
it to manifest. It works off the heterodyne principle. If you mix two ultra=
sonic waves that differ one another in frequency then if you add or subtrac=
t them together you get a beat frequency or alternate frequency. For exampl=
e, if a ghost is sending a signal at 54KHz and you have an electric fan in =
a room creating an untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you will have a inter=
mediate difference frequency at 9KHz, well within human hearing range =
(20Hz to 20KHz). This was just an example, but all electronic equipment gen=
erates ultrasonic signals just by turning them on. From this theory I alway=
s felt that EVP were generated within a few inches of the recorder.</DIV>
<=
DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>We are able to reproduce this affect in not only radi=
o with superheterodyne systems but also with acoustics and audio as in some=
 passive sonars and a commercial produce called the "audio spotlight" by Dr=
. Joseph Pompeii.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>Frank R.<BR><BR>--- On <B>Mo=
n, 6/8/09, Zack Widup <I><w9sz.zack@gmail. com></I></B> wrote:<BR></D=

BR>

<DIV id=3Dygrp-text>
<DIV>
<DIV>Fascinating! I'=
ve had this idea that the EVP are often not recorded by the microphone=
 but somehow make their way in at the actual point where the storage i=
s made, whether it be analog (tape) or digital. <BR></DIV>
<DIV>So muc=
h we don't know ...</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>Zack</DIV>

<DIV>I am curious if anyone with a micropho=
ne wired to a remote site has ever gotten any EVP in real time.</DIV>
<DIV>=
 </DIV>
<DIV>I took part in an investigation of Ashmore Esta=
tes, near Ashmore IL, on Saturday night. We had six video cameras set up in=
 the three halls of the building. The video for all was being monitore=
d and recorded at a central location. Alas, we did not have microphone=
s at the camera sites conected to the central location. I wonder what we mi=
ght have heard if we did?</DIV>
